Literature Review: Ion mobility (IM) technology has undergone significant advancements in recent years, revolutionizing the field of mass spectrometry and enabling the separation and characterization of gas-phase ions of biomolecules. The integration of IM with mass spectrometry has opened up new avenues for the analysis of complex biological systems, including glycomics, lipidomics, peptidomics, and proteomics. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of the art in high-resolution and multidimensional IM experiments, highlighting their strengths and potential applications in biomolecular analysis.
